moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. c3 Bg7 4. d4 cxd4: d5, anyway: exd6ep, Qxd6, is not bad for Black...
moves.16. h5 Bb7 17. Nd2: a moment of hesitation in the White camp...
not quiet, what White had hoped for...
moves.26. e6 d4: opening up, the LSB diagonal: prepared a while ago...
moves.27. Rfh1: a useless effort, from the start: there are no threats across the h-file...
moves.29. Nf7 Ng4+ 30. fxg4 Rxe6: Black has sacced a Knight to expose Whites' King: after Bf5, Rxf7...
moves.32... Rxf7: and with this, White resigned: Blacks' combined threats (Rg6xg4xg2+) will win the game...
